website_summaries.verdict: A nice v-shaped smoker box that can be placed beneath the rack of a gas grill.
pros: This well-designed smoker box gets props for being one of the few v-shaped models available, which makes it able to fit under the rack of a gas grill
cons: Because it sits under the grill, putting the chips closer to the heat source, the chips burn up quickly and require replenishing
The fact that it is positioned underneath the grill makes replenishing awkward

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and works great!
customer_reviews.text: I had a smoker box that sat on top of the grill but it wasn't close enough to the gas element to smoke. Luckily I bought this one earlier this week and it worked GREAT! The wood chips lasted between 30 - 45 min (after soaking) at 225 degrees and it produced a lot of smoke. Very happy and I would recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Product performed perfectly, used dry chips, 1/2 full all the way on side of grill, got smoke around 400F and dropped the grill down to 350 for 20ish minutes of plenty of smoke to get some chicken drums and bread done nice. My eyes burned and lungs every time I opened the lid just to peek. I’d cook lower temperature and longer next time.
customer_reviews.author: Brando

customer_reviews.title: Good concept, but lacks in delivery
customer_reviews.text: I dont recommend this product. The holes in the top of this smoker allow grease to through to the woodchips and then it causes them to catch fire. I continously have to watch to make sure they are not catching fire. I recommend a smoke box that you can sit directly on the grates instead of in between the pilot light shields. I recently bought a pellet smoker tube and it works a lot better and the wood pellets last a lot longer.
customer_reviews.author: ergibson83

customer_reviews.title: I believe the vent holes are to large.
customer_reviews.text: The products fits nicely beside the gas burners! Its easy to load, and easy clean out expended chips, wood. The issue I have are the top vent holes. I found it allowed my soaked chips to dry out and burn out very quickly, less than 20 minutes. I have been using aluminum pouches directly over the burners with small slits. My wood burns slowly, and imparts the smoke I want, over a 45 to 60 minute time frame. It holds liquid, so may use as a steamer on one side of grill and my pouches of wood on the other. Sorry this may have been way to much information. Well built!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not stainless steel as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Item photo clearly shows what appears to be a stainless steel smoker box. What was delivered was plain, black painted steel instead which will not last for very many years. The packaging also says nothing about stainless steel except for a small sticker added after manufacturing. I'm sending it back and finding another that is true to its listing.
customer_reviews.author: beachcomber_bill

customer_reviews.title: limited use.  OK so far.
customer_reviews.text: Shipped early. Appears new/ not used. No damage Fits well between flavor bars on Spirit II 200 style grill I can open the smoker to add more chips without removing the unit from the grill. Top opens easily with a pair of tongs Held up to initial heating and limited grilling to date. Some discoloration as expected Easy to clean. Open and dump any ash that remains Haven't done a long smoke yet so flavor has been on the light side as expected Will continue to try various heat levels & amount of wood chips. Have had both a moderate but steady plume of smoke and an all out fire so far
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Smoker box
customer_reviews.text: Just got the smoker box this week and I’m using it for the first time it seems to be a strong construction easy to use chips fits perfectly and it fits perfect in my grill don’t know how long it will last or how it will work now with the heat update later but so far I will give it a five star
customer_reviews.author: albert

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This "long" model is a perfect fit for my new model Weber Genesis (with front controls and burners running front-to-back.) Sits flush with the top of the flavorizer bars. I was fortunate to have chosen the E330 model grill with the "Sear Station" burner. We bought two of theses smoker boxes and place one on each side of the sear burner. Using the sear burner only, set on low the grill maintains perfect barbeque temperature and the boxes provide smoke for a good amount of time. As a true barbeque fanatic it's hard to admit that we achieved real slow-smoked barbeque from a gas grill!
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: Smokin'!
customer_reviews.text: This V-Shape Smoker Box works very well for adding smoke flavor with my Weber gas grill. Before, I had to use my charcoal grill if I wanted to add smoking chips. As great as charcoal is for flavor, it requires more planning and time. Being able to soak my chips for 30 minutes, and throw them into this box, load it on the grill when I add my meat is much easier. Clean out is also simple. Just open and knock out the ashes. This is a great accessory for any gas grill!
customer_reviews.author: A. Silverstone

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Webber propane grills
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my Webber propane grill. It fits between the flavorizor bars and smokes well. The only limitation I have noticed is that if I’m filling my grill I can’t refill the box - which isn’t a problem for me since I don’t run out of smoke in the 1 hour cooks times I’ve used. I suspect if (when) I try something longer it will be lower temp and indirect heat so I won’t need the grill on the heat side which will allow me to easily refill.
customer_reviews.author: faffod

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I have a Broil-King 5 burner gas BBQ and this fits perfectly in-between the flame suppressor grooves. Used it to add some hickory smoke flavor to my Tri-Tip and it was spectacular. I expect this to last a long time and will be using it a lot to add some flavor to all my BBQ meals. Pros: -Fits well between the grill grates and the flames. -Easy open hinged lid -Easy to clean -Solid construction Cons: - It's a little tipsy but it is a triangle.
customer_reviews.author: Ludo

customer_reviews.title: Too wide to fit under Weber Silver Series B grates - read this:
customer_reviews.text: Weber Silver Series B grill has two grates - right and left. This product is about 1.25x the width of one of these grates, so you'll still have to lift both grates in order to put this under them. A minor PITA, so I wouldn't buy this one again for this particular grill/application. Hindsight is 20-20. This issue more of a buyer error than the product's fault, and the product quality seems decent overall, particularly for $11.
customer_reviews.author: RH in D

customer_reviews.title: Wood doesn't get enough air flow
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to place on the flavorizer bars of my Weber grill with the meat on the grates for a good half hour before lighting the grill so the meat could absorb more smoke. However, the wood wouldn't stay lit. I light the wood with a blow torch. I will try drilling several small holes in the sides to promote air flow and will try again.
customer_reviews.author: B. Pad

customer_reviews.title: Great little idea!
customer_reviews.text: It smokes as it says! I was really surprised how well it works. It’s not so easy to clean though. One must remember any item used for cooking requires some elbow grease to clean so other than that I would certainly recommend giving it a try. Be careful choosing wood as some is saw dust & others are real wood chips!
customer_reviews.author: Sparky

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly terrific product!
customer_reviews.text: With the Weber Genesis and cooking times in the 20-30 minute range, i.e. not steaks, this product works amazingly well and provides the perfect amount of smoke flavor. Best combinations to my palate so far: pork ribs with hickory chips, tri-tip roast with mesquite, pork loin with apple. And it doesn't require a lot of maintenance — I just empty it and give it a quick once-over and the natural seasoning takes care of the rest.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey P. Vasquez

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Smoker Box
customer_reviews.text: I had been thinking about getting one of these for a long time. When it showed up on my Alexa deals for a heavy discount I couldn't resist. I'm glad I didn't and wish I had gotten one sooner. Pros: - Unobtrusive sitting directly on the deflectors on my Weber Genesis Grill it is out of the way. - Holds a decent amount of chips Cons: - You can't add chips easily for long slow cooking. Since it sits under the grates no access without moving the hot grates.
customer_reviews.author: --chris

customer_reviews.title: A little less smoke.
customer_reviews.text: We knew going into purchasing we would not be getting a full smoke flavor that you would get with a conventional smoker, it does put out smoke for awhile. When you have to add more chips for more smoke , the lid flips open smoothly with the use of long handled tongs. Our first thing we smoked was a spice rubbed Ham shank. Turned out delicious. Have used many times since then. Clean up is easy.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Weber Summit 4 burner grill
customer_reviews.text: This smoke box fits perfectly in my weber summit. Fits right between the flavor bars and when you put the actual grill grate back down, it sits flush like before the smoke box was even there. I do get a hint of smoke when i grill up wings and burgers but i was hoping it would be much stronger. Maybe I throw more wood chips in the box
customer_reviews.author: cayman

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Smoke box seems to be doing the job, fits perfectly and allows enough area forwood chips to smoke a Butt on the grill
customer_reviews.author: Rick Adragna

customer_reviews.title: Good smoker for Weber Genesis Grill
customer_reviews.text: I have used this several times with my Weber Genesis grill. It fits good and rests between the flavor bars underneath the cooking grate. After about 20 minutes on grill it produces a good amount of smoke, and food tastes pretty good. It is a lot better than the smoke boxes. Nothing beats smoked food on a charcoal grill, however, for the convenience of using a gas grill, I'm happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tom P.

customer_reviews.title: Almost returned this, now I like it
customer_reviews.text: The dream is to make your gas grill in to a smoker. EHHH! won't happen. I tried this with low heat long time cooking and it sucked. Many things I cook are high heat to start , then cook it thru. So forget soaking the wood chips. Throw them in a couple minutes before the main course so they start to smoke. Turn down the temp if needed and TADA! You have some smoke flavor. I only get maybe 15 minutes of smoke but it does come through in the flavor.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: weber genesis
customer_reviews.text: Finally found a wood chip/pellet smoker that works on my Weber Genesis. Most chip smoker won't work as they are too far from the flame and don't get hot enough. This one being V shaped fits closer to the burner. Seem to work best for me with dry smoking pellets.
customer_reviews.author: 0711dog

customer_reviews.title: Great for Weber Genesis Grills
customer_reviews.text: I've used these (I bought 2 stainless) 3 times now with my Weber Genesis 300 series grill. The large fits perfectly in between my seer station burner. I place each of them on either side of the burner and let it ride on low. The chips last about 4 hours and my grill sits perfectly at 225 degrees. I've only cooked baby backs on it so far but they come out perfect after 4 hours. Longer cooks you may need to refill the smoker box but for ribs it has been great. The smoker box is in great shape still and I think it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb Sparkman

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I needed a smoker for my gas grill. This thing works well and fits in my Webber grill. Time will tell if it holds up well long term but so far so good and no complaints here.
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl

customer_reviews.title: Tricky To Use
customer_reviews.text: Disclaimer: I'm not that good of a griller so I'm not the best to review. It is very awkward to use and then having to replace the wood chips in the metal triangle which it's scorching hot is no easy task. What was I thinking?
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, seems to fit most grills
customer_reviews.text: I used mine for the first time and was impressed. It fits down under the grating so doesn’t take up grill space. The fact it is so close to the flames allows the wood to burn without overheating the cook space.
customer_reviews.author: Mike L

customer_reviews.title: Not for a Weber Genesis II
customer_reviews.text: Using on a Weber Genesis II and it will not light the wood chips. Preheating grill at over 500 for 25 minutes, starts to smoke then quits. I have cast iron smoke box that sits on the flavorizer bars and works finr.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Good product could use some tweaking.
customer_reviews.text: Never used a smoker before. This is really good. Only flaw I fouyis that when it sits between the the 2 burners is that it is not stable and tends to tilt and to add more chips it is difficult and feels like it’s going to fall into the grill. I wish it had some cross stabilized bars to keep the devise level and a way to open the lid easy so you can add more chips when needed. Would still recommend
customer_reviews.author: Eric & Soraya

customer_reviews.title: Not really worth it
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the time and effort to use this. I bought the Jack Daniels chips and soaked them. You will have to replace the chips often, which means lifting up the hot grill grate opening up the hot metal box and putting more chips in. Unless your smoking something small like chicken wings it is a lot of time and effort to use this product. Even with wings your going to have to replace the wood chips at least once.
customer_reviews.author: Jules M

customer_reviews.title: Perfect design for gas grills
customer_reviews.text: Design works perfectly for gas grills as it fits between grates and doesn't tip pr slip. Holds nice amount of wood and easy to add more if needed; lifts and cleans well. Since the grill side is usually turned off where it sits, I'm guessing it will last fairly long.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: RUSTY STEEL NOT STAINLESS
customer_reviews.text: Living in the rainy Pacific Northwest, I bought this one because it was stainless steel. NOT! After two years it is pretty much completely rusted out. I keep it stored on the lower shelf of my grill, and the grill is stored under a porch roof out of the weather. I'd suggest to anybody buying one of these, use some charcoal grill paint to paint it before the first use. The paint might help it not to rust. Too late for me. I'll just have to buy a new one. Other than that, it works OK.
customer_reviews.author: TacomaDrone

customer_reviews.title: Bought 2; 1 stainless & 1 was painted!!
customer_reviews.text: Part numbers on box were the same and even the patent numbers stamped on the steel were the same. However, one of them was not stainless steel and will not last long. I am contacting the seller and will update this review once I hear back.
customer_reviews.author: TGOII

customer_reviews.title: Been working well
customer_reviews.text: We place below the grill, on top of the burners. Use of wet pre-soaked wood takes 10-15 minutes to start smoking. Nice product has held up well for several months.
customer_reviews.author: William Lane

customer_reviews.title: I was happy with the results
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these as an expirement to see if I could smoke on my Weber Genesis E-330 grill. I was happy with the results. I do think that the smoker box is likely not as efficient as having a dedicated smoker, however the end result of the food was good.
customer_reviews.author: sterling taylor

customer_reviews.title: If you don't have a smoker, this is a viable option for your larger cooks of meat.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my gas grill to try and add some smoke to my grilling. Unfortunately with grilling the basics such as steak and burger, high heat is best so the wood chips tend to ignite even after soaking. I think this would be better suited for someone who doesn't have a smoker but uses their grill to cook larger pieces of meat such as whole chickens and such. One added benefit that I don't think that was an intended use is it can act as a shield from some of the flare ups you get while cooking on a propane grill.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin P.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I put this in my gas grill between the flavorizer bars and it add smoke for about 2 hours once it gets going. Great for cooking items with smokey flavor at low temps when you don't want to invest in a real smoker. The meat won't be the same as if it was in a real smoker but is tastier with it then without!
customer_reviews.author: Cheetos18

customer_reviews.title: Great Smoker Box for Weber Genesis
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for use in a Weber Genesis 4-burner Grill. Works perfectly between two flavorizer bars. Quality is good.
customer_reviews.author: Adam N. Boeding

customer_reviews.title: Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: This smoker box works great and is easy to use. I was surprised at how well-made it is. Even the hinge seems to be quite heavy-duty. I would recommend a smaller one for a 2-burner grill. You can't go wrong with this brand!
customer_reviews.author: S. D. Schumacher

customer_reviews.title: This unit looks and works GREAT!.
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have if you are using any of the new gas grills that use " V " shape burners . A conventional flat smoker box just won't do the job , but this one will . That' because the surface of the smoker receives 50% to 75% more heat ..... giving you the amount of smoke you need . This unit is stainless steel meaning it won't rust and will last and last and will never look nasty / rusty in your grill . This unit looks and works GREAT ! ..... why would anybody use any other smoker ? ? ? Buy your Best and Last Smoker FIRST !
customer_reviews.author: BayGuy1943

customer_reviews.title: Fits my Weber Spirit perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I've got one of the old Weber Spirit with the knobs on the side and it fits on the flavorizer bars perfectly. No problems with installing the grates plenty of clearance
customer_reviews.author: Anna M. Boley

customer_reviews.title: Fits the new Weber Genesis grills perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace using aluminum foil pie pans for wood chips based on a review I read that stated it fit well between burners on the newer Genesis grills... and yes it does. The fit could leave one to think this was made for the Weber. I have only used it a couple of time, so I can't comment on durability, but I am happy so far. Smaller wood chips are a must (like the chips one would buy in the grilling section of a home improvement store). I use branches that fall from the pecan trees in my yard and just cut them down. Pretty good product and like I said, I am happy so far.
customer_reviews.author: Knight511

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as soaked wood chips on a charcoal fire but not bad
customer_reviews.text: It works but no comparison to chips on a charcoal fire. You'll need a lot of chips to get the same affect. Its well made.
customer_reviews.author: Credx2

customer_reviews.title: Works Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have used it twice since receiving. Wood chips catch fire quite easily even when completely soaked. Metal seems to be quite thin and I feel like it's going to rust fairly quickly. Decent smoke production on my gas grill. For the price can't complain.
customer_reviews.author: Ken McCreight

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and concept but make sure you measure your ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a Professional Series Char-Broil gas grill. It turned out the box (13.8") was too wide for my grill. Even if the length was correct for this model my grill had no flame defector bars (thought these were just burners), that the box could rest on. Good quality and concept but make sure you measure your grill accurately and that you have these flame defector bars fairly close together. I could still use the box but with limited results.
customer_reviews.author: hwca

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Good smoker box. If you're not a rabid smoker but you like a little smoke flavor once in a while, this is perfect for you. East to use. Gets meats a smoke flavor without smoking all day. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Zigwagger

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm; good value
customer_reviews.text: This smoker box fits nicely between my Weber Spirit 210's "flavorizer bars" and has enough capacity for a 5-hour rib-smoking session. It works really well for the price and the build quality suggests it will serve me well for several grilling seasons. Like anything subject to the type of heat this smoker box will endure, the finish will mar and the box may warp (mine did), but none of the above keep it from getting the job done (and at a pretty decent price).
customer_reviews.author: Geoff

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: While the idea seems good, product itself is not made that well. It will still gets it use but could have made more sturdier.
customer_reviews.author: Sunil

customer_reviews.title: Works!!!
customer_reviews.text: Works fine... Easy to use. Sometimes it lights up in flame... Make sure you have a squirt bottle in handy. Many smoker boxes flame because of too much oxygen. What you can do is cover the smoke box with aluminum foil and poke the wholes accordingly. I usually use 2 to 3 wholes. Works great
customer_reviews.author: mohamed

customer_reviews.title: Works great just doesn’t sit in grill as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Works well just had to angle it between the last burner and side wall not to fall, doesn’t fit between two burners/flavor bars as advertised
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Sykes

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for Weber Grills
customer_reviews.text: While I am (impatiently) waiting for my wife to give me the thumbs up to get a Big Green Egg I purchased this smoker box. Being stainless I believe it will be much more durable than a cast iron box. It is not super deep so if you use wood chunks you may have to split some of them to get the lid to close all the way. But whether you soak the wood or not this allows food to get that smoke flavor without having to use a charcoal grill. This fits perfectly between the flavorizor bars of my Weber grill. Great stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Lord_Sag

customer_reviews.title: Essential Accessory for any Gas Grill
customer_reviews.text: This box fits in perfectly between the flavorizer bars on the Weber gasser. The wood does not flame out and it seems to provide enough smoke to flavor the meat on the grill. Nothing works as well as a smoker, or a charcoal grill for flavoring the meat with wood, but this does a nice job on a gasser to get some. My only gripe and it is a small one, is it is basically a messy thing to clean up. I think a thoughtfully placed handle to grab with tongs would be usefull. Otherwise, it is an essential accessory for your gasser.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn I. Dubin

customer_reviews.title: It's a little bigger than I expected, but I'm keeping it!
customer_reviews.text: I know that this works before I even purchased it I have a different kind but the principal is the same one thing it's just a little too big for my grill.
customer_reviews.author: domecq

customer_reviews.title: Great component
customer_reviews.text: I used these often with my grilling. The fit nicely in between the flavor bars and performed well for cooking operations. If you have to restock the chips it is a little more difficult as you have to remove the hot grates. Remember to leave the grate out prior to loading to make access easier and then place the cool grate just before grilling.
customer_reviews.author: CRizzo

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply Made
customer_reviews.text: I don't have high hopes for this product. Nice design for gas grills, but cheaply made out of THIN stainless sheet. Worst part is this is CHEAP 400-series stainless. How to tell? Stick a magnet to it. Yes, it's MAGNETIC stainless. This will rust/corrode over time worse than "real" 300 series stainless. Poor execution on a decent design. I bought the long version as well to hopefully get more smoking time. However, it is slightly too long so I have to remove BOTH my cooking grates to fill this thing easily.
customer_reviews.author: KrustyCow

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these. Considered buying the short one, and considered buying only one. I'm glad i bought two. Used it in my weber EP-330. It gets the wood down to the heat source, which I think, for low and slow grilling, is where it should be. The wood chips did burn up rather quickly (10 mins) but it smoked and imparted some flavor into the chicken. I'll continue to use these, can't really complain, they fit, they hold enough wood and they smoke the wood. The only really pain is that they are beneath the grates. Not really a problem on some indirect grilling if you leave that side of the grate off.
customer_reviews.author: SIMarKee

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Works great out of the gate but seems to slow down on producing smoke after the first batch of wood chips burn. I wonder if this has to do with ashes building up in the bottom of the v. I would absolutely purchase again. Works better than the smoker box that I had in the grill before.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew T.

customer_reviews.title: This is a very good product. I first put wet chips in & ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good product. I first put wet chips in & cooked like that. I don't think that worked very well. I then put dry chips in & cooked like that. I think that worked better. I like the way this box fits in my new Weber Grill. I think I'm going to like this box very well.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t emit much smoke flames up too easily
customer_reviews.text: I’ve found that this is just a big smoker box. Holds a lot of chips but does nothing but flame up and emits little to no smoke. I’ve found that the smaller the box the better the smoke. Bummed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid smoker box
customer_reviews.text: My husband was very happy with this smoker box, it fit our built in Bull BBQ perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: L. Peters

customer_reviews.title: NO MORE FOIL PACKETS
customer_reviews.text: This is a great smoker, much better than making those foil packets. It fits in between the flavorizor bars on a gas grill. I have noticed that it takes about 20-30 mins to get the wood to smoke though, but once it gets hot enough works great and it's easy to add more wood to. Heavy Duty steel, I've had no warping problems, only discoloring due to heat but that's to be expected. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Zig

customer_reviews.title: Lovin' It
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased 3 of these smoker boxes, the first time for myself and since, I've found this to be the perfect gift. It's a breeze using this and forget a mess, you simply dump the old chips and clean the box. I plan to get a smoker, but for now, this will do and is a great priced alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Colin

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than I though it would be...but it works!
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, I didn't pay attention to anything other than the length of the box and should of looked at the rest of the dimensions as well since the volume is a little on the small side....but that was my fault. The box fits perfectly between two of my burners and does exactly what it was designed to do. I really wouldn't use this to try and use your grill as a smoker since my experience was that it did not provide enough smoke to do that. I will use it when I'm cooking steaks to add a little flavor to the meat!!
customer_reviews.author: Rafter Man

customer_reviews.title: I used it recently to make rosemary chicken by loading rosemary branches into the Charcoal Companion and it worked great.
customer_reviews.text: Using this on my Weber Genesis E-330. I tried a couple of locations, but I prefer the space between the left wall and the far left burner. It can really put out the smoke, but if you are looking to long-term smoke something, you'll need to reload chips in here and that is a little tricky if you have to lift the grate to add the chips. I used it recently to make rosemary chicken by loading rosemary branches into the Charcoal Companion and it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: SFMetalhead

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly on my CharBroil grill with 5 burners. Make sure your grill had the burners close enough for this to fit between. I had a 4 burner grill that had t0o much space between before this one.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Jeannet

customer_reviews.title: Great smoker!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is trick! Filled with my wood chips and placed directly on burner smokes like crazy. Im guessing it doesnt allow enough air to actually flame. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Ray Sadesky

customer_reviews.title: I like it works well.
customer_reviews.text: I only gave three stars for sturdiness because I've only used it a few times and so far works well, we will see how low it lasts. Fits great.
customer_reviews.author: Rogue

customer_reviews.title: Works good for gas grills
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfectly between angled flare up protectors on my Weber gas grill, hope they last last a while!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Norris

customer_reviews.title: Really good and well made product
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I had no bending problems as some reviews indicated. Fill it up with well-soaked smoker chips and enjoy. I have a Weber Spirit 2 burner grill. I place the smoker on the right hand side, burner 2. I set the left burner medium high for a hot zone and right burner lower for a cooler zone. With that the smoker does it's job without flaming out. The first mesquite smoked tenderloins were absolutely astounding! Buy the "long" one. Enough capacity to get the job done. I would think you would run short of smoke otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: John from the Berkshires

customer_reviews.title: returned
customer_reviews.text: didn't like the idea of having to lift the grate to access box
customer_reviews.author: Garea51

product_meta.title: Charcoal Companion Stainless Steel V-Shape Smoker Box For Gas Grill Wood Chips (Long) - CC4066
product_meta.description: Gas grills are considered by many to be the most convenient way to grill but unfortunately this usually means giving up great smoky flavor for convenience. The Charcoal Companion Smoker Box features a V-shape bottom which allow it to sit between the flame deflector bars of most gas grills. This positions the smoke right beneath the food grate for the most intense smoke flavor. Stainless steel smoker box has hinged lid and is reusable. Add wood chips of your flavor choice and place between the flame deflector bars on the gas grill. (wood chips not included)
feature_bullets: V-shape fits between flame deflector bars on gas grills for the most intense smoke flavor
Sturdy stainless-steel construction withstands high grilling temps
Hinged lid allows for easy access to add wood chips (not included)
Ashes remain in smoker box, keeping your grill clean and ready to use
